contentrichtext.text: {{No footnotes|date=March 2010}} '''Calvert Watkins''' (March 13, 1933 – March 20, 2013) was a [[professor Emeritus]] of [[linguistics]] and the [[classics]] at [[Harvard University]] and professor-in-residence at [[UCLA]].<ref name="HG-obituary"/> His doctoral dissertation, ''Indo-European Origins of the Celtic Verb I''. ''The Sigmatic Aorist'' (Dublin Institute for Advanced Studies, 1962), which deeply reflected the [[structural linguistics|structuralist]] approach of [[Jerzy Kuryłowicz]], opened a fresh era of creative work in [[Celtic language|Celtic]] [[comparative linguistics]] and the study of the verbal system of [[Indo-European languages]]. Watkins, in a sense, completed his contribution to this area with his ''Indogermanische Grammatik III/1: Geschichte der Indogermanischen Verbalflexion'' (1969). Meanwhile, his work on Indo-European vocabulary and poetics yielded a large number of articles on (among others) [[Celtic languages|Celtic]], [[Anatolian languages|Anatolian]], [[Greek language|Greek]], [[Italic languages|Italic]] and [[Indo-Iranian languages|Indo-Iranian]] material, presented most thoroughly in his book, ''How to Kill a Dragon: Aspects of Indo-European Poetics'' (Oxford University Press, 1995). He contributed his expertise on [[Indo-European languages]] to the first edition of ''[[The American Heritage Dictionary of the English Language]]'' and edited ''The American Heritage Dictionary of Indo-European Roots'' (ISBN 0-618-08250-6).<ref name="HG-obituary"/> He was married to the prominent Sanskritist [[Stephanie Jamison]].<ref name="HG-obituary"/> ==References== {{reflist|refs= <ref name="HG-obituary">{{cite news|url=http://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2013/03/calvert-watkins-dies-at-80/|title=Calvert Watkins dies at 80|last=Reuell|first=Peter|date=March 28, 2013|publisher=[[Harvard Gazette]]|accessdate=10 May 2013}}</ref> }} ==External links== * {{worldcat id|lccn-n84-226736}} * [http://static.scribd.com/docs/km058hvpku1jx.pdf Essay by Calvert Watkins on Indo-European, from The American Heritage Dictionary of the English Language] * ''How to Kill a Dragon: Aspects of Indo-European Poetics'', [http://books.google.com/books?id=Ri4sbTiMKN4C&printsec=frontcover&dq=intitle:How+intitle:to+intitle:kill+intitle:a+intitle:dragon&lr=&as_drrb_is=q&as_minm_is=0&as_miny_is=&as_maxm_is=0&as_maxy_is=&as_brr=0&cd=1#v=onepage&q&f=false limited preview] {{Harvard-CA}} {{Authority control|VIAF=17742381}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Watkins, Calvert | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American linguist | DATE OF BIRTH = March 13, 1933 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = March 20, 2013 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Watkins, Calvert}} [[Category:1933 births]] [[Category:2013 deaths]] [[Category:American linguists]] [[Category:Celticists]] [[Category:Historical linguists]] [[Category:Harvard University faculty]] [[Category:University of California, Los Angeles faculty]] {{US-linguist-stub}}
